content: Many thanks to everyone for their time and effort in contributing to the set of prospective Helios use cases. Weâ€™ve compiled the feedback that the community provided and have posted the updated and consolidated spreadsheet to the Helios Confluence site - https://confluence.hl7.org/display/PH/2022+Use+Cases

We have also begun to engage our interim Steering Committee who will be tasked with identifying a small set of use cases to focus on in 2022. The slide deck from our initial session along with a recording are also available on Confluence.

I looked at the consolidated list - I note that the FHIR artefacts mentioned for #4 - at-home results do not match the use case (smart card is intended to verify the result, but it is not explicitly the result of record - i.e. this verifies the stated result is correct, but it is not intended to include all result information) - so who would make this assertion for at-home testing? Suggest to update the file to point to the OO project At-Home test instead, as that will tackle how to communicate the actual result and related meta data = https://jira.hl7.org/browse/PSS-1892
Thanks @Riki Merrick . We'll update the master list of use cases
